title: 🟧 Smart Composting Bins
text:
NYC Smart Composting Bins, deployed by the Department of Sanitation, make composting easy and accessible across all five boroughs. These bins are available 24/7 and are a key part of the city’s Zero Waste plan, helping reduce landfill use and support a more sustainable future for New York City.

title: 🌱 All About Composting
text:
🍎 Composting in NYC
Food waste accounts for approximately 1/3rd of New York City’s residential waste stream!
New York City began piloting its smart compost bin program in late 2021. Since then, the program has expanded to include nearly 400 bins located across all five boroughs.
The Department of Sanitation has prioritized bin placement near New York City Housing Authority (NYCHA) properties to improve access for residents in public housing. This effort aligns with the city’s broader zero waste goals.
In fiscal year 2024, the smart bins recorded 154,355 unique users and were unlocked a total of 1,215,618 times.
New York City residents can also register to collect end-product compost for free!

🚚 Curbside Composting

As of April 1st, 2025, all NYC residents are required to separate food scraps, food-soiled paper, or yard waste from trash, at the risk of being fined.
